items.title: Top 10 trending phones of week 51
items.summary: With 10 days remaining of the year 2025, we have the very familiar sight of Samsung Galaxy A56 topping our trending chart. Behind it, however, is a fresh new face in the newly announced OnePlus 15R. The Galaxy S25 Ultra rose two spots to complete the penultimate podium of the year. [#InlinePriceWidâ€¦

items.title: Stunning Rogers double secures Villa win over Man Utd
items.summary: Morgan Rogers scores twice for Aston Villa in their 2-1 win against Manchester United, extending Villa's unbeaten run to 10 matches in all competitions.

items.title: Liverpool fear significant lower leg injury for Isak
items.summary: Liverpool fear Alexander Isak has sustained a significant lower leg injury after the striker was forced off against Tottenham on Saturday.

items.title: The 35 best gifts that your teen will actually use
items.summary: Between keeping up with TikTok trends and whatever new gadget just dropped, it's tough to know exactly what teens are into these days. Luckily, we can help. We may be older than teenagers, but many of us here at The Verge are kids at heart. Plus, we've also got a few staffers with older kids. To maâ€¦

items.title: Job killer
items.summary: Park Chan-wook's 12th feature-length movie, No Other Choice, begins with Man-su (Lee Byung-hun) as a proud patriarch at the barbecue, a vision of the platonic ideal domestic life he will spend most of the movie defending. In the long middle where life is lived, the movie offers its audience mirth aâ€¦

items.title: How AIM taught the internet to chat
items.summary: If you were an internet user around the turn of the century, there's a good chance I could play a one-second long sound of a door opening and memories would immediately come flooding back. Memories of running home from school and logging onto AOL Instant Messenger to chat with your friends or your â€¦

items.summary: This is The Stepback, a weekly newsletter breaking down one essential story from the tech world. For more on robotics and AI, follow Robert Hart. The Stepback arrives in our subscribers' inboxes at 8AM ET. Opt in for The Stepback here. We're taking a winter break! The Stepback will be back on Januaâ€¦

items.title: RayNeo X3 Pro AR glasses review: Intriguing, high-priced glasses with alarming battery life
items.summary: If you have a short attention span and money to blow, the RayNeo X3 Pro might be up your alley, as it's expensive and has short battery life.

items.title: Vonn will be 'in a good place' for Winter Olympics
items.summary: American Lindsey Vonn claims her fourth podium finish in five World Cup races this winter, ahead of the 2026 Milan-Cortina Winter Olympics.

items.title: Nintendo Switch 2 to reportedly get smaller capacity game cartridges soon, offering an alternative to costly 64GB cards â€” Storage crisis might delay production, however
items.summary: The Switch 2's Game-Key Card controversy has a burning new development, and we might finally have a middleground between expensive 64 GB Game Cards and digital-only releases. Smaller capacity cartridges, such as 16 or 32 GB, are reportedly in production but industry-wide shortages might disrupt theâ€¦

items.title: Stokes wants to remain captain despite Ashes defeat
items.summary: England captain Ben Stokes says he "absolutely" has the energy to still lead the side after defeat by Australia in the third Test in Adelaide meant they lost the Ashes at the earliest opportunity.

items.title: Booze, beach, beaten â€“ how England lost the Ashes
items.summary: BBC Sport chief cricket reporter Stephan Shemilt reveals the inside story of England's Ashes defeat in Australia on and off the pitch.

items.title: England execution not good enough for long enough - Stokes
items.summary: England captain Ben Stokes expresses pride in his side's "character and fight" in the third Test but admits they were not good enough for long enough to claim a victory.

items.title: McCullum admits he's made mistakes after Ashes defeat
items.summary: Brendon McCullum says his side haven't lived up to "high hopes and expectations" after failing to regain The Ashes, but that fans can expect his side to "show what we're capable of achieving" in the final two Test matches in the series.

items.title: 'I put my hands up' - McCullum admits Ashes mistakes
items.summary: Coach Brendon McCullum accepts England may have made mistakes with their Ashes preparation after their series defeat was confirmed in Adelaide.

items.title: England unable to hold out as Australia retain the Ashes
items.summary: Australia beat England by 82 runs to take a 3-0 series lead and retain the Ashes urn on day five of the third Test in Adelaide.

items.title: OnePlus 15T's specs tipped
items.summary: Back in October, tipster Digital Chat Station shared specs of a compact OnePlus smartphone, said to arrive in the first half of 2026. Now, DCS has shared the specs of the OnePlus 15T, which will feature a 6.3" 165Hz screen of 1.5K resolution with a 3D ultrasonic fingerprint scanner embedded. The Onâ€¦

items.title: 10 moments that decided the Ashes
items.summary: Australia have regained the Ashes after winning the first three Tests against England down under once again - here are the 10 moments that decided the destination of the urn.

items.title: The moment that Australia retained the Ashes
items.summary: Marnus Labuschagne takes the catch from Josh Tongue as England are bowled out for 352, giving Australia an 82 run win and a 3-0 series lead to retain The Ashes on day five in Adelaide.

items.title: 'Test career over for now?' - Ashes player ratings
items.summary: Chief cricket reporter Stephan Shemilt marks the performances of the Australia and England teams after the third Test in Adelaide.

items.title: 'That's the wicket' - Labuschagne takes brilliant grab to dismiss Jacks
items.summary: Marnus Labuschagne takes another brilliant catch at slip as Will Jacks is dismissed for 47 to leave England on 337-8 on day five of the third Ashes Test in Adelaide.

items.title: 'It's frustrating' - Smith out for 60 after poor shot
items.summary: Australia make the breakthrough as Jamie Smith is caught for 60 to leave England on 285-7, needing 150 runs to win the third Test on day five in Adelaide.

items.title: Redmi Note 15 Pro 5G in for review
items.summary: Redmi's Note 15 series has arrived on the global stage, and as you'd expect, it's a bit confusing. You've got the Redmi Note 15, the Redmi Note 15 5G, the Redmi Note 15 Pro, the Redmi Note 15 Pro 5G (the star of this article), and the Redmi Note 15 Pro+ 5G. We have all five phones at the office andâ€¦

items.title: Williamson beats Simpson after four knockdowns in Leeds

items.title: Given shares Howe's frustrations on trio of decisions

items.title: How Man City smothered West Ham with 'suffocating' press
